page.title: 01ST. MARK'S SCHOOL, NATLAND.
page.content: A school has existed in{Natland}for a hundred and fifty years, once an all age school but now a{primary school. It has progressed from being contained within the{church}to a frequently extended building next to it. In 1967 the present school opened a short distance away. There are now 140 pupils, 5.4{teachers}and a special attachment tutor. The{longest serving member of staff, Mrs. Airey, has been at the school for sixteen years. Altogether eighteen people work at St. Mark's, including{cooks, ancillaries {and the cleaner. This year the number of school governors doubled and a new{Head}(Mr. Chandler),{Deputy}(Mr. Robinson) and another teacher (Mrs. Simpson) joined the staff. There were numerous visits, including one to{Levens Hall}to see replicas of the{Crown Jewels.
